title: Professor
biography: Matthew Caesar is a Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. He received his Ph.D. at UC Berkeley in 2007. His research focuses on the design, analysis, and implementation of distributed systems and networks on the extremely large scale, with an emphasis on network operations, measurement, and availability. He is particularly interested in improving availability and performance of the Internet infrastructure, including routing, DNS, and data centers. Matthew has a long history of successful technology transfer, including his startup company Veriflow, which was sold to VMware in 2019. He has received several awards, including the NSF CAREER award (2011), DARPA CSSG membership (2011), CAS Fellow (2013), and IEEE Fellow (2023).
